intro: Ninanga, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the genus Phormium and is characterized by its broad, sword-shaped leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces striking violet or red flowers in late winter or early spring. Its fibrous leaves are traditionally used by Māori for making clothing, baskets, and other crafts. Ninanga thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas.
